docs.lead_paragraph: In the latest sign that the financial gloom over Europe is lifting, some of the region's most cash-strapped governments are raising money on bond markets — and finding it cheap.

headline.main: Portugal, Spain Find Debt Cheaper as Trust Returns
headline.print_headline: Portugal, Spain Find Debt Cheaper as Trust Returns

docs.snippet: In the latest sign that the financial gloom over Europe is lifting, some of the region's most cash-strapped governments are raising money on bond markets — and finding it cheap.

headline.main: Elliott to Accept Increased Tender Offer for Celesio

docs.abstract: The announcement by the hedge fund Elliott Management ends an impasse that threatened to block the $8.3 billion deal by the McKesson Corporation for the German pharmaceutical wholesaler Celesio.
docs.snippet: The announcement by the hedge fund Elliott Management ends an impasse that threatened to block the $8.3 billion deal by the McKesson Corporation for the German pharmaceutical wholesaler Celesio.

docs.lead_paragraph: Republicans on Wednesday seized on the 50th anniversary of the "War on Poverty" to attack long-cherished Democratic social programs and roll out their own alternatives for fighting income inequality.

headline.main: In an Election Year, Republicans Join the Debate on Poverty
headline.print_headline: In an Election Year, Republicans Join the Debate on Poverty

docs.snippet: Republicans on Wednesday seized on the 50th anniversary of the "War on Poverty" to attack long-cherished Democratic social programs and roll out their own alternatives for fighting income inequality.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration enters the year locked in a battle with Congress over whether to plow ahead with new economic sanctions against Iran or cautiously wait to see if last year's breakthrough nuclear agreement holds.

headline.main: Obama, Congress Locked in Iran Sanctions Dispute
headline.print_headline: Obama, Congress Locked in Iran Sanctions Dispute

docs.snippet: The Obama administration enters the year locked in a battle with Congress over whether to plow ahead with new economic sanctions against Iran or cautiously wait to see if last year's breakthrough nuclear agreement holds.

docs.lead_paragraph: At Resorts World Casino, where employees’ average pay doubled last year, a buffet restaurant that recently increased its prices has now closed.

headline.main: After Winning a Raise, 175 Casino Workers in Queens Lose Their Jobs
headline.print_headline: After Winning a Raise, 175 Casino Workers in Queens Lose Their Jobs

docs.abstract: Buffet restaurant in Resorts World Casino in Ozone Park, Queens, closes, with 175 workers losing their jobs; casino had received praise in late October of 2013 when a labor arbitrator issued a ruling that doubled employees' average pay; New York Hotel Trades Council, union representing the buffet workers, hopes to negotiate with owner Genting Group for other jobs at the casino.
docs.snippet: At Resorts World Casino, where employees’ average pay doubled last year, a buffet restaurant that recently increased its prices has now closed.

keywords.value: Resorts World Casino New York City
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: Gov. Peter Shumlin devoted his entire State of the State speech to Vermont’s “full-blown heroin crisis.”

headline.main: In Annual Speech, Vermont Governor Shifts Focus to Drug Abuse
headline.print_headline: In Annual Speech, Vermont Governor Shifts Focus to Drug Abuse

docs.abstract: Vermont Gov Peter Shumlin devotes his entire State of the State Message to epidemic of heroin addiction in the state; says he wants to encourage officials to respond to addiction as a chronic disease, rather than with only punishment and incarceration.
docs.snippet: Gov. Peter Shumlin devoted his entire State of the State speech to Vermont’s “full-blown heroin crisis.”

docs.lead_paragraph: Proliferating measures are making it harder for women to access abortion care.

headline.main: Abortion Restrictions in Texas and Beyond
headline.print_headline: Abortion Restrictions in Texas and Beyond

docs.abstract: Editorial submits federal appeals court decision to overturn injunction against enforcing Texas's abortion restriction underscores tenuous state of women's reproductive rights in United States; asserts proliferation of such measures is making it more difficult for poor women to obtain abortions; urges supporters of abortion rights to fight harder to roll back these restrictions.
docs.snippet: Proliferating measures are making it harder for women to access abortion care.

docs.lead_paragraph: Chris Christie, the straight-from-the-hip paladin of the Palisades, is beginning to emerge as small, petty and vindictive.

docs.lead_paragraph: Some 1,300 newlywed same-sex couples in Utah were thrown into turmoil by the governor’s decision not to recognize their marriages while the state presses its legal efforts to ban them again.

headline.main: Utah Says It Won’t Recognize Same-Sex Marriages It Licensed
headline.print_headline: Utah Says It Won’t Recognize Same-Sex Marriages It Licensed

docs.abstract: Fortunes of 1,300 newlywed same-sex couples in Utah are thrown into turmoil after the office of Gov Gary Herbert announces that it will not recognize their marriages while it presses its legal efforts to limit marriages to one man and one woman.
docs.snippet: Some 1,300 newlywed same-sex couples in Utah were thrown into turmoil by the governor’s decision not to recognize their marriages while the state presses its legal efforts to ban them again.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
